Past Events

Below is an overview of events organised by the SciML community. We aim to put recordings of each event online within a week of them taking place.

Please get in touch if you’d like to come to talk to us, we’re a very diverse group in terms of applications in scientific machine learning and would to hear about your work!

Seminars

Title Speaker Date Recording
Regional climate model emulator based on deep learning Antoine Doury (French National Centre for Meteorological Research) 29th Nov, 2024 Link
Rapid Spatio-Temporal Flood Modeling - Hydraulic GNN Approach Roberto Bentivoglio (Delft University of Technology) 16th Feb, 2023 Link
Forecasting Global Weather with Graph Neural Networks Ryan Keisler (KoBold Metals) 10th Nov, 2023 Link
Could deep learning methods replace numerical weather models? Mariana Clare (European Centre for Medium Range Weather Forecasts) 20th Oct, 2023 Link
Feature-Preserving Point Cloud Simplification with Gaussian Processes Thomas. M. McDonald (University of Manchester) 14th Jul, 2023 Link
Physics-based domain adaptation for dynamical systems forecasting Zack Xuereb Conti (Alan Turing Institute) 19th May, 2023 Link
ClimaX: A foundation model for weather and climate Tung Nguyen (UCLA) 17th Mar, 2023 Link
Sea ice detection from concurrent visible and SAR imagery using a convolutional neural network Martin Rogers (British Antarctic Survey) 24th Feb, 2023 Link
Physics-informed Machine Learning for Trustworthy Climate Emulators Björn Lütjens (MIT) 10th Feb, 2023 Link
Explainable AI for identifying regional climate change patterns Zack Labe (Princeton) 13th Jan, 2023 Link
Extending the capabilities of data-driven reduced-order models to make predictions for unseen scenarios Claire Heaney (Imperial College) 18th Nov, 2022 Link
